meanings.definition: A man who assists women in childbirth.
meanings.sent1: The accoucheur helped the mother during the delivery.
meanings.sent2: The accoucheur was skilled at aiding women in giving birth.
meanings.sent3: The accoucheur joked with the new father to ease the tension in the room.
meanings.sent4: The accoucheur's calm demeanor was like a guiding light in the birthing process.
meanings.sent5: The accoucheur's presence was reassuring to the expectant mother.

meanings.sent1: The accoucheur arrived just in time to assist with the delivery.
meanings.sent2: The hospital had a team of accoucheurs ready for any birth.
meanings.sent3: The accoucheur's quick reflexes saved the day during a complicated birth.
meanings.sent4: The accoucheur's dedication to helping newborns enter the world was admirable.
meanings.sent5: The accoucheur's gentle touch comforted the laboring mother.

meanings.sent1: The accoucheur provided care and support to the expectant mother.
meanings.sent2: The community praised the accoucheur for his compassionate approach to midwifery.
meanings.sent3: The accoucheur's sense of humor lightened the mood in the delivery room.
meanings.sent4: The accoucheur's knowledge and expertise were invaluable during the birth.
meanings.sent5: The accoucheur's gentle hands guided the baby into the world.
